content: reading through docs I can see multiple things related to prime powers dividing functions like factorization, padicValNat, multiplicity. So I am a bit confused, what I want to know is how to write n as product over n.primeFactors. what would be the theorem for that? or what is the theorem stating prime factorization exists for number in the canonical format.
It is all a bit of a mess. There are many definitions that all do the same thing. @Paul Lezeau and I are working towards making docs#Nat.factorization the standard
Thanks! Nat.prod_pow_factorization_eq_self is close enough to what I want, doing a simp [Finsupp.prod] converts it into a product over primeFactors
Sabbir Rahman has marked this topic as resolved.
